notes.text:
An update for openvswitch2.13 is now available for Fast Datapath for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Open vSwitch provides standard network bridging functions and support for
the OpenFlow protocol for remote per-flow control of traffic.

Security Fix(es):

* openvswitch: ip proto 0 triggers incorrect handling (CVE-2023-1668)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Bug Fix(es):

* [23.C RHEL-8] Fast Datapath Release (BZ#2184495)

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

notes.text: A flaw was found in openvswitch (OVS). When processing an IP packet with protocol 0, OVS will install the datapath flow without the action modifying the IP header. This issue results (for both kernel and userspace datapath) in installing a datapath flow matching all IP protocols (nw_proto is wildcarded) for this flow, but with an incorrect action, possibly causing incorrect handling of other IP packets with a != 0 IP protocol that matches this dp flow.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: openvswitch: ip proto 0 triggers incorrect handling
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: In OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) the openvswitch rpm package is consumed from the RHEL Fast Datapath repositories, hence OCP openvswitch components are marked as "Will not fix".
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

For any version of Open vSwitch, preventing packets with network
protocol number '0' from reaching Open vSwitch will prevent the issue.
This is difficult to achieve because Open vSwitch obtains packets before
the iptables or nftables host firewall, so iptables or nftables on the
Open vSwitch host cannot ordinarily block the vulnerability.

Another method would be to add a high priority flow to the flow table
explicitly matching on nw protocol '0' and handling that traffic
separately:

   table=0 priority=32768,ip,ip_proto=0 actions=drop

This would need to be similarly done for IPv6 traffic as well.

vulnerabilities.title: openvswitch: ip proto 0 triggers incorrect handling
